text: The installation of Java on Ubuntu can be performed using two primary methods: installing OpenJDK (the open- source implementation) or Oracle JDK (the o Ưicial Oracle version). 1. Installing OpenJDK (Recommended for most users): This method utilizes the apt package manager for a straightforward installation. Update package lists. Code sudo apt update  Install the default JRE (Java Runtime Environment) or JDK (Java Development Kit): o For JRE: Code sudo apt install default-jre  For JDK (includes JRE and development tools): Code sudo apt install default-jdk Verify the installation. Code java -version 2. Installing Oracle JDK: This method involves downloading the Oracle JDK package and manually conﬁguring it. This is typically required for speciﬁc applications that mandate Oracle's o Ưicial distribution or for development environments that rely on speciﬁc Oracle JDK features.  Download the Oracle JDK: Visit the Oracle Java SE download page and download the appropriate .deb or .tar.gz package for Linux x64.  Install the downloaded package (for .deb): Code sudo dpkg -i jdk-<version>_linux-x64_bin.deb (Replace <version> with the actual version number.)  Extract and conﬁgure (for .tar.gz): o Create a directory for Java: Code sudo mkdir -p /opt/jdk Move and extract the archive. Code sudo mv jdk-<version>_linux-x64.tar.gz /opt/jdk/ cd /opt/jdk/ sudo tar -zxf jdk-<version>_linux-x64.tar.gz Conﬁgure Java alternatives. Code sudo update-alternatives --install /usr/bin/java java /opt/jdk/jdk-<version>/bin/java 1 sudo update-alternatives --install /usr/bin/javac javac /opt/jdk/jdk-<version>/bin/javac 1  Set JAVA_HOME environment variable (for both methods if needed): o Edit the /etc/environment ﬁle: Code sudo nano /etc/environment  Add the following line, replacing the path with your JDK installation directory: Code JAVA_HOME="/usr/lib/jvm/default-java" # or JAVA_HOME="/opt/jdk/jdk-<version>" for Oracle JDK Apply changes. Code source /etc/environment Verify the installation. Code java -version Code echo $JAVA_HOME
